content.description: Start with a super rad compression stand thing, make your way to the crack, then hit the jugs on the outside lip. After getting a high bump make a sketchy but super satisfying mantle that you prooobably don't want to fall on. Other than the large boulder that might break your fall, this problem is perfect.
content.protection: Couple pads and definitely a spotter.
content.location: Fraggle Area. The semi-cave in between Master of Puppets and T.O.B.

content.description: Stand start on cool hand holds and walk up on big feet till you can reach a good left hand dish. After that a right hand and high feet take you to the fun slabby top out.
content.location: Just right of TOB, should be noticeable.

content.description: Good face holds are everywhere. SDS and climb as high as you dare. The top out is covered with a split 500 lbs block so be careful if you pull the lip. Typically down climbed after you slap the highest hold. Another 15' to the right is a slab with a fun little problem on it.
content.location: Just the the right of the Fraggle formation and the "cave".

content.description: Start up the pocketed slab till you get to the bomber hold mid way through the climb. Work up to one more jug then toput
content.location: To the right of Fraggle Rock. As you come up to the area it's large zig zag arête. You can't miss it.

content.description: Stand start on the left side of the Ride the Lightning Boulder. Traverse left to right, back into the mantle of RTL.
content.location: On the left side of the Ride the Lightning Boulder.

content.description: Eliminate. Mystery Arete without using the arete. Start left in large pocket and right on small sidepull. Make your way up using smears, knobs and small features on the face to a good rail.
content.location: In between Mom and Slab n Dab.

content.description: stand start on the face just to the right of Mystery Arête.
content.location: On the same boulder as Mystery Arête. The slab on the right.

content.description:
An extension of Ride the Lightning. SDS with both hands on the low slopey rail. Then go for the big sloper hueco and work your way back into the original route. Epic mantle to finish.

The smaller rock to the right and in between this boulder problem and Mystery Arete, is off
content.location: On the Ride the Lighting Boulder and to the left of Mystery Arête

climbs.name: Ride the Lightning
climbs.fa: Edwards, Greene, '90s? Devlin Gandy et al, 00s? Who knows

content.description: In the cluster of boulders across from the Mystery Boulders. Crouch start on two sidepulls, make two big moves in a row and mantle the lip. Punchy and might be a little sandbagged. The new sds is a lot better.
content.location:
Just left of SlabNDab. Cluster of boulders by Fraggle.

Walk around this problem to find

Problemo Uno

. Starts way back in the cave on your left and climbs out into a mantle at the hat like feature. Actually super fun despite your butt being inches off the ground. Good for kids. Problemo

Dos

starts sitting under the hat and is basically the end moves of Uno.

Tres

starts from the right of the hat and traverses left 6 ft into Uno.

Quattro

is a fine mental problem-start at head high crimps and go up to a hidden jug.

Project

is a very cool arete forming the left side of the cave that Uno exits.

content.description: start on the overhanging arete to the right of A Horse Named Mystery. No tricks with this route just few obvious holds up an overhang, but bad landing makes it quite committing. Start with left hand on bomber undercling and right on side pull. Then use pinches and crimps to work up the arête till you reach the same exit holds as A Horse Named Mystery then mantle up.
content.protection: At least two pads and spotter. Bad landing over a huge boulder
content.location: Fraggle area in between A Horse Named Mystery and T.O.B.

content.description:
The extended cut of Northeast Jungle Cat, throwing in a couple hard, awesome moves.

Start matched in the crack on the far right edge of the T.O.B. slab.Work your way across the slab using a collection of bad pinches and great feet. Slap left hand into a sloper, fall into a bad right hand pinch, control that barndoor, slap out left again into the start of Northeast Jungle Cat, lock off super hard and get ready to pull some V6 moves!! Super rad and not to be missed.

The climb has been done without using the massive block in the right corner for feet. That said, all the feet are so good, there's probably no difference in grades if you do or don't use it.
content.location: Fraggle area. Starts on the far right edge of the T.O.B. slab and finishes on Northeast Jungle Cat

content.description:
Absolute classic... perfect volcanic arête with pockets, pinches and exposed topout.

Stand start with a good left hand undercling and a sharp right crimp. Climb up the arête and face holds to good topout. Start is prolly the crux.
content.location: In the Fraggle Rock area. On the left as your coming up the hill, before Something's Gotta Give and the Fraggle climbs. To the right of Ride the Lightning.

content.description: There are a couple variations that Melissa figured out while I was projecting Maharaja. The rock can be loose but once cleaned up could serve as a nice warm up.
content.location: To the left of the Maharaja P.

content.description:
Crouch start on the left, toss to the jug on the lip and mantle. Then grab the arete and mantle again directly above. Try and do a SDS for added pump and to bump the grade up. Proud and scary.

June 2016-there's talk of D. Gandy's crew putting this up (and other lines). If they'd like to change it since they have the FA? please post the lines they collected while in town and we will update/delete this page. If the rumor mill is wrong I want to call this

Master of Puppets

. Let us know, happy to have correct info. Mantling once and immediately pulling onto the slab is

Pinocchio V2

and is pretty fun in it's own right.
content.protection: bring your best spotter and cushiest pads
content.location:
This formation forms the town side of the

Horse Named Mystery

cave.

content.description: Unfinished project, Maharaja. Stand start the arete from holds on the overhanging side. Go up to a right facing sloper ledge, transfer somehow to the left facing sloper ledge and top out from there. Would be awesome to see this go.
content.protection:
Pads and spotters.

Check the top for loose shit before you go.
content.location: backside of the cluster of boulders before Fraggle

content.description: Start under the lip of Ride the Lightning Bolt in two hand jams and twist around till you can get a foot over your head. Invert style your way over awkwardly.
content.protection: Nothing, pads just get in the way..
content.location: Under the rail on Ride the Lightning Bolt

content.description:
A small face with a crack in it. Most problems here are eliminates and I don't think they deserve their own pages. The rock up here is cleaning up nicely, it gets early afternoon shade, and the problems are fun enough to be good warmups for the harder things close by. There is a connector trail to the powerline trail near here.

Alex pimping the Veasy crack on a nice summer day:

youtube.com/watch?v=xgXUvKn…

More potential up here the further towards town you walk.
content.protection: pads but great landings up here
content.location: 3 minutes west up the hill from the Mystery Boulders. 12-15 minutes from Irish Boulders.

content.description: Stand start with left had on jug and right on knob. Hike right hand up to a sloppey but decent hold up right. Gather feet and go way out left to the lip or find the intermediate crimps to gain the lip. Exit direct. Left exit drops it down significantly.
content.location: The right arête on Fraggle Rock.

content.description: Crouch start with a left hand on a loose pinch and a right on a tit shaped rock. Stand up, grab the dagger, and use good feet to get to a pocket. A pull from here gets you to top out jugs. Maybe the best v-easy problem in the circuit.
content.protection: Pad and spotter as the landing slopes away.
content.location: Pile of rocks just ahead of you when getting to the powerline trail. 1 minute from Mystery Boulders. Please don't walk directly up to the formation. Walk up the powerline trail and then back towards the face of this problem for easiest and least impacting access.

content.description:
Crawl to the back of the chimney and get yourself locked into the smallest part of the crack. From there thrutch an curse your way to the top using body locks and chicken wings. Loose ish rock near the top, but nothing to cry about.

Also a long sleeve shirt and pants would be recommended. This thing eats clothes.
content.protection: A pad if you can make it fit.
content.location: Located in the chimney seen between Fraggle Rock and Mystery Arete. Hard to miss. (Don't mess with the oak growing at the front)
